body.p: The Interpretation does not specify the accounting by grantors, because the IFRIC’s objective and priority were to establish guidance for operators. Some commentators asked the IFRIC to establish guidance for the accounting by grantors. The IFRIC discussed these comments but reaffirmed its view. It noted that in many cases the grantor is a government body, and that IFRSs are not designed to apply to not‑for‑profit activities in the private sector, public sector or government, though entities with such activities may find them appropriate (see Preface to IFRSs paragraph 9).
